title: Unique Morse Code Words
description: International Morse Code defines a standard encoding where each letter is mapped to a series of dots and dashes, as follows: 'a' maps to '.-', 'b' maps to '-...', 'c' maps to '-.-.', and so on. Given an array of strings words where each word can be written as a concatenation of the Morse code of each letter. For example, 'cab' can be written as '-.-..--...', which is the concatenation of '-.-.', '.-', and '-...'. We will call such a concatenation the transformation of a word. Return the number of different transformations among all words we have.
